[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: CTVerifyError::AssociatedDataDoesNotMatch] [Replay Attack] When associated data verification fails, is the ciphertext permanently marked as invalid, or can it be replayed later with correct associated data for malicious purposes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: CTVerifyError::SigVerificationFailed] [Signature Malleability] Does wrapping ed25519_dalek::SignatureError properly handle signature malleability issues, or can attackers create multiple valid signatures for the same ciphertext causing consensus confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: CTVerifyError::SigVerificationFailed] [Error Amplification] Can an attacker craft ciphertexts that trigger SigVerificationFailed in a way that cascades to other validators, causing widespread verification failures and network-wide decryption paralysis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: EvalProofVerifyError] [Zero-Knowledge Bypass] Can an attacker submit ciphertexts with invalid eval proofs that pass initial checks but fail verification later, potentially allowing non-verifiable decryption attempts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: EvalProofVerifyError] [Proof Forgery] Are eval proof verification failures properly logged and monitored, or can malicious validators repeatedly attempt proof forgeries without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: UncomputedEvalProofError] [State Machine Bypass] Can an attacker trigger decryption before eval proofs are computed by exploiting race conditions between proof generation and decryption request handling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: UncomputedEvalProofError] [DoS Through Incomplete State] Can Byzantine validators intentionally leave eval proofs uncomputed to prevent legitimate decryption, causing permanent fund locking or transaction failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: EvalProofsWithUncomputedCoefficients] [Coefficient Computation Attack] Can an attacker manipulate the ID set to reference coefficients that are computationally infeasible to derive, triggering EvalProofsWithUncomputedCoefficients and preventing threshold decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: EvalProofsWithUncomputedCoefficients] [Dependency Inversion] If eval proofs require uncomputed coefficients, can this create circular dependencies that deadlock the decryption pipeline across all validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: DecryptionKeyShareVerifyError] [Threshold Manipulation] Can malicious validators submit invalid decryption key shares that trigger verification errors but still contribute to threshold computation, potentially corrupting the final decrypted output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: DecryptionKeyShareVerifyError] [Share Equivocation] Does DecryptionKeyShareVerifyError detection prevent validators from submitting multiple conflicting shares for the same ciphertext, or can they equivocate to confuse honest participants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: DecryptionKeyShareVerifyError] [Timing Side-Channel] Can the time taken to verify and reject invalid key shares leak information about the true decryption key, enabling gradual key recovery attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: DecryptionKeyVerifyError] [Aggregated Key Forgery] After combining threshold shares, can DecryptionKeyVerifyError be bypassed through careful manipulation of individual shares that appear valid but produce an invalid aggregated key? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: DecryptionKeyVerifyError] [Post-Aggregation Attack] If the aggregated decryption key fails verification, are the individual shares permanently discarded, or can they be maliciously reused in different threshold combinations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructImproperNumShares] [Threshold Confusion] Can an attacker manipulate the number of shares submitted to be exactly t but with duplicates or invalid shares, bypassing ReconstructImproperNumShares but producing incorrect reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructImproperNumShares] [Sybil Attack] If share count validation is insufficient, can a single Byzantine validator submit multiple shares under different identities to control threshold reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructImproperNumShares] [Liveness Attack] Can malicious validators deliberately withhold shares to keep the number below threshold t, triggering ReconstructImproperNumShares indefinitely and causing permanent decryption failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructDigestsDontMatch] [Digest Collision] Can an attacker craft decryption key shares with colliding digests that pass initial equality checks but represent different cryptographic values, bypassing ReconstructDigestsDontMatch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructDigestsDontMatch] [Partial Agreement Attack] If some validators accept shares with matching digests while others reject them, can ReconstructDigestsDontMatch cause consensus failure and validator set partitioning? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: ReconstructDigestsDontMatch] [Digest Forgery] Are the digests used for matching cryptographically strong, or can attackers generate shares with identical weak digests for different underlying keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: Hash2CurveFailure] [Quadratic Residue Attack] Can an attacker craft inputs that systematically fail to produce quadratic residues, triggering Hash2CurveFailure and preventing ciphertext generation or validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: Hash2CurveFailure] [Subgroup Membership Bypass] If Hash2Curve fails to map to the correct subgroup, can partially computed results be exploited to perform small subgroup attacks on the encryption scheme? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Error: Hash2CurveFailure] [Determinism Violation] Is Hash2CurveFailure handling deterministic across all validators, or can platform-specific failures cause consensus divergence when processing identical inputs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: BatchEncryptionError] [Error Swallowing] Are BatchEncryptionError variants properly propagated to calling code, or can critical cryptographic failures be silently ignored leading to security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: BatchEncryptionError] [Information Disclosure] Do the error messages in BatchEncryptionError leak sensitive cryptographic parameters, key material, or internal state that could aid in attacking the encryption scheme? (Medium)
